unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**

unnormalised: Lucknow, UP – Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming for complete coverage by 2025. This initiative is a key component of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: Lucknow, U P – Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (U P P C L) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming for complete coverage by two thousand and twenty five. This initiative is a key component of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: As of 17/10/2024, over 50 lakh smart meters have been installed in urban areas like Kanpur and Agra. Consumers report increased billing transparency and better control over their energy consumption. Concerns regarding data privacy are being addressed through stringent security protocols compliant with national standards.
normalised: As of seventeenth october two thousand and twenty four, over fifty lakh smart meters have been installed in urban areas like Kanpur and Agra. Consumers report increased billing transparency and better control over their energy consumption. Concerns regarding data privacy are being addressed through stringent security protocols compliant with national standards.

unnormalised: "We are committed to providing reliable and affordable electricity to all," stated Mr. Sharma, UPPCL Chairman, during a press conference at 11:00 hrs yesterday. The project is expected to generate significant cost savings for both UPPCL and consumers. The next phase, commencing on 25/12/2024, will focus on rural electrification, aiming to install an additional 20 lakh meters. The estimated investment for the entire project is Rs. 10,000 crores. Successful implementation will pave the way for advanced grid management and promote energy conservation, aligning with India's Panchamrit goals. Early data suggests average monthly savings of Rs. 200 per household.
normalised: "We are committed to providing reliable and affordable electricity to all," stated Mister Sharma, U P P C L Chairman, during a press conference at eleven hundred hours yesterday. The project is expected to generate significant cost savings for both U P P C L and consumers. The next phase, commencing on twenty fifth december two thousand and twenty four, will focus on rural electrification, aiming to install an additional twenty lakh meters. The estimated investment for the entire project is rupee ten thousand crore. Successful implementation will pave the way for advanced grid management and promote energy conservation, aligning with India's Panchamrit goals. Early data suggests average monthly savings of rupee two hundred per household.
